events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on March 30th involving her sedan and another vehicle at an intersection.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorized under the Auto Accident cluster to proceed with specialized handling.
An agent from the auto claims team was assigned to the case to guide the client through the claims process and gather necessary documents.
The claim acknowledgment was sent to the customer promptly to confirm receipt and outline next steps for document submission.
Customer was requested to provide the police report, photos of the accident, and repair estimates to evaluate the claim accurately.
The customer successfully submitted all required documents, including the police report and vehicle repair estimates for the damages.
The investigation into the vehicle collision was initiated, including reviewing submitted documents and contacting witnesses as needed.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer is not liable for the accident, and the damage assessment is validated.
A settlement offer was proposed covering the cost of repairs and compensation for the damages to the customer's vehicle.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the process and compensation offered.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department following the customer's acceptance of the proposed settlement.
Payment was issued to the customer to cover the agreed compensation amount for the auto damages as per the settlement.
The claim case was officially closed after confirming payment delivery and receiving no further inquiries from the customer.
